CSettingsStorage Class Reference

#include <MSettingsStorage.h>

Inheritance diagram for CSettingsStorage:

Detailed Description

Abstract class that represent a storage mechanism.

Derive from it and implement the Integer, Simple and Extended types SaveLoadItem() functions. Implement also the Implementation overrideables functions.

It's up to the derived class to add methods for opening and closing the storage.

virtual bool ContinueOnError ()=0
 The result of this function is used to determine if the storage may continue to read/write items after a failed one.


Overrideables

Returning false in OnBeforeXXX() will disable the calls to SaveLoadItem() but OnAfterXXX() will still be called.

Helpers functions

These functions handles conversion from/to similar types of the handled ones (the ones that are pure virtual).

The derived class does not need to override them, but they are still made virtual in case special handling is desired.

Collections related functions

The derived class can implement them directly.

If it does not, standard behaviour is provided. The standard behaviour is 'Count' based, so the derived storage has to be Name/Value pair behavioured.

virtual bool OnBeginCollection (LPCTSTR szName, UINT &ItemCount, bool bSave)
 Called before browsing items.

virtual int OnItemCollection (UINT Index, CSettings &variable, bool bSave)
 Called for each item in the collection.

virtual bool OnEndCollection (bool bSave)
 Called after browsing all items.

virtual bool OnBeginAloneCollection (LPCTSTR szName, UINT &ItemCount, bool bSave)
 Internal function for stand-alone types collections.

virtual int OnItemAloneCollection (UINT Index, bool bSave, LPCTSTR &ItemName)
 Called before each item in the stand-alone collection.

virtual bool OnEndAloneCollection (bool bSave)
 Internal function for stand-alone types collections.

Member Function Documentation

virtual CSettingsStorage* CSettingsStorage::CreateSubStorage (  LPCTSTR  SubName  )  [pure virtual]
 

Subclasses must override this function to return a heap allocated object that represent a substorage of this.

SaveLoadItem() functions will be called from this substorage. So the returned Storage object must be opened with the SubName and ready to operate, but OnBeforeXXX() will be called before any SaveLoadItem().

virtual bool CSettingsStorage::SaveLoadItem (  LPCTSTR  szName,
TCHAR *  Variable,
ULONG &  size,
bool  bSave
)  [pure virtual]
 

Strings.

When saving, size contains the length of the string. This function can ignore it.
When loading, size contains the maximum size Variable can handle. If it's not enough, this function should set size to the requested size (with NUL) and return false. If you fail to load the value, return false and set size to 0.
When Variable contains NULL, you must only set size to the requested size and return true. You can return false to indicate failure.

virtual bool CSettingsStorage::OnBeginCollection (  LPCTSTR  szName,
UINT &  ItemCount,
bool  bSave
)  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Called before browsing items.

When saving: If ItemCount contains 0xFFFFFFFF, it indicates that the count is not known, but the implementor should handle this case. He should count the number of OnItemCollection() calls to determine the count (if needed).
When loading: ItemCount must contain a valid value on return. It can contain 0xFFFFFFFF to indicate that the count is not known.

Definition at line 192 of file MSettingsStorage.h.

virtual int CSettingsStorage::OnItemCollection (  UINT  Index,
CSettings &  variable,
bool  bSave
)  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Called for each item in the collection.

Returns:
  • 0 indicates failure.
  • >0 indicates success.
  • <0 indicates 'no more items' (only used on Load if ItemCount was 0xFFFFFFFF). The current item is ignored.

Definition at line 215 of file MSettingsStorage.h.

virtual int CSettingsStorage::OnItemAloneCollection (  UINT  Index,
bool  bSave,
LPCTSTR &  ItemName
)  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Called before each item in the stand-alone collection.

Generate here the item name and put it in ItemName. Subclasses can override it to changes the standard behaviour which is: "Item.%i" where i is the Index.

Returns:
  • 0 indicates failure. The item will not be processed.
  • >0 indicates success.
  • <0 indicates 'no more items'. The loop will be broken and the current item is ignored. Note that the string you pass in ItemName will not be freed at any time, so the best way is to have a subclass member for that string.

Definition at line 289 of file MSettingsStorage.h.
